messages.title: An election message from ANDREW COOPER
messages.content: I am asking for your support to be Huddersfield's next MP.

mentions.tacticalSituation: As a Green Party MP, unlike Labour, Conservative or Lib Dems, I wouldn't have Party bosses telling me how to vote.

issues.economy: The Huddersfield Blueprint is a good start but we need to act to ensure that local market traders and other locally owned and managed businesses are what we prioritise in Huddersfield if it is to have a vibrant future.
issues.environment: protect our local trees both in our streets and those threatened by development.
issues.health: I share the passion of many local people to maintain Accident and Emergency and other vital health services in Huddersfield and I have joined demonstrations and made many representations to that end.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have been elected to the Newsome Ward of Kirklees Council for the last 20 years. I have been elected and re-elected 6 times. During that time I've taken up literally hundreds of issues and concerns of local people.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Kirklees Council, Newsome Ward
politicalExperience.achievements: elected and re-elected 6 times, taken up hundreds of issues and concerns of local people

leaflet.additionalNotes: Please show your support for my campaign by displaying the poster on the reverse in your window and if you would like to help with our campaign please get in touch.
